abstract: Sales in China helped lift overall iPhone sales by 88 percent over the same quarter a year ago, dispelling fears that sales would lag in nations with lower annual incomes.
snippet: Sales in China helped lift overall iPhone sales by 88 percent over the same quarter a year ago, dispelling fears that sales would lag in nations with lower annual incomes.
lead_paragraph: Not long after the iPhone came out, skeptics questioned how much appeal the costly device and related wireless service would have in countries like China with lower income levels. On Tuesday, Apple provided the answer: A lot.

headline.main: Apple Profit Rises on Higher iPhone and iPad Sales
headline.print_headline: After iPhone Sales Bonanza in China, Apple’s Profit Nearly Doubles
